title: England haka face-off fine sparks charges of hypocrisy for World Rugby
text:
Rugby World Cup organisers were accused of hypocrisy after fining England over their V-shaped haka face-off just days after releasing a viral video paying tribute to the act of defiance against New Zealand.

Social media bosses claim World Rugby's video entitled "England's incredible response to intense New Zealand Haka" stands to earn up to £5,000 after YouTube footage was watched 4.5 million times.

Richard Caborn, who was sports minister when England last won the World Cup in 2003, said the governing body's subsequent fine was "absolutely ridiculous" as he urged officials to donate the viral video proceeds to charity. "I just think it's an overreaction bordering on hypocrisy," he told the Telegraph...
description: Rugby World Cup organisers were accused of hypocrisy after fining England over their V-shaped haka face-off just days after releasing a viral video paying tribute to the act of defiance against New Zealand.
